name: ifs-mcp-server
description: Connect Claude to IFS Cloud ERP and build your own agent the way you want.
long_description:
## IFS Cloud MCP Server

This extension connects Claude to your IFS Cloud ERP instance using OAuth 2.0 authentication.

**What you can do:**
- Authenticate with IFS Cloud using your browser (OAuth device flow)
- Query any IFS OData API endpoint with natural language
- Export large result sets to CSV with automatic pagination
- Build and share reusable API guides (skills) for common IFS projections
- Import skills from URLs or local files — no restart needed

**Getting started:**
1. Enter your IFS Cloud URL, OAuth realm, and client ID in the settings below
2. Ask Claude to `start_oauth` to authenticate
3. Start querying your IFS data

See the [README](https://github.com/knakit/ifs-mcp-server-local#readme) for full setup instructions and examples.

api_base_url.title: IFS Cloud URL
api_base_url.description: Base URL of your IFS Cloud instance, e.g. https://your-tenant.ifs.cloud

oauth_realm.title: OAuth Realm
oauth_realm.description: Your IFS OAuth realm name, e.g. mycompanyrealm

skills_dir.title: Skills Directory (optional but recommended)
skills_dir.description: Absolute path to a folder where your skills (.md files) are stored. Recommended — skills saved here persist across extension updates. If omitted, skills are written inside the extension bundle and will be lost when the extension is updated.

tools.name: start_oauth
tools.description: Start OAuth 2.0 authentication flow. Checks for active session and opens a login window if needed.

tools.name: get_session_info
tools.description: Get information about the current saved session, including session ID and expiration status.

tools.name: call_protected_api
tools.description: Call a protected IFS Cloud API endpoint using an authenticated session.

tools.name: get_api_guide
tools.description: Get the API guide for a specific IFS projection. Call this before using call_protected_api to learn the correct endpoints, OData syntax, and query patterns.

tools.name: export_api_data
tools.description: Export large API result sets to a CSV file using automatic $top/$skip pagination.

tools.name: import_skill
tools.description: Import an IFS resource guide (skill) from an HTTPS URL or local file path and make it available immediately.

tools.name: save_skill
tools.description: Save an IFS resource guide (skill) to the skills library. For new skills, writes immediately. For existing skills, returns a summary of what changed.

prompts.name: build_ifs_skill_guide
prompts.description: Build or update an IFS resource guide (skill) from a browser HAR file, a downloaded OpenAPI/Swagger spec, or by fetching the spec live from an authenticated IFS session.
prompts.text: Build or update an IFS resource guide (skill). Provide exactly one of: har_file_path (path to a browser HAR export), openapi_file_path (path to a downloaded OpenAPI/Swagger spec), or projection_name (to fetch the spec live from an authenticated IFS session). Claude will analyse the input, draft a guide in the correct format, and save it automatically.
